data.meta_description: Pink Floyd, David Gilmour, Nick Mason's Saucerful Of Secrets, and Roger Waters news as it happens, information, exclusive interviews, reviews, pictures, tour news, downloads and more!, Echoes - The Best Of Pink Floyd September 29th, 2001    It all started in 1966, amid the psychedelic...
data.text:
Echoes - The Best Of Pink Floyd

September 29th, 2001

It all started in 1966, amid the psychedelic explosion then sweeping swinging London. In small, smoky clubs like the UFO and the Roadhouse, Syd Barrett, Roger Waters, Nick Mason, Rick Wright and David Gilmour galvanized the vibrant British rock scene with their extended free-form instrumentals and surreal pop songs -- all performed to the accompaniment of bobbing blobs of multi-colored liquid lights. Perhaps even more than Cream and Jimi Hendrix, the quartet known as Pink Floyd were psychedelia personified.

Twenty-two albums later, 160 million in records sales and sold out tours to an estimated 25 million fans, Pink Floyd are arguable the greatest rock band of all time. No other band has relentlessly tinkered with electronics and all manner of special effects to push pop formats to their outer limits. At the same time they have wrestled with lyrical themes and concepts of such massive scale that their music has taken on an almost classical, operatic quality, in both sound and words.

From the classic concept albums of 'Dark Side Of The Moon' and 'Wish You Were Here' to the progressive cult favorite, 'The Wall' (3rd best selling album of all time), Pink Floyd's lyrics made icons out of LSD, pigs, Power stations and brick walls while their music riddled with secret messages and wild imagery, reached mythic proportions.

Now, Capitol Records is proud to release 'Echoes - The Best Of Pink Floyd' on November 6th, which under the band's active participation, is the first and only compilation to span the bands entire 35-year career. Highlights of this definitive collection include :

2 CD's, 27 tracks and over 140 minutes of music mixed together as one piece of continuous music

A previously un-released track on CD, "When The Tigers Broke Free"

Brilliant box package with a special 32 page booklet and complete lyrics

Original art which is a unique interpretation of Floyd covers over the years conceptualized, art directed and shot by long time Floyd collaborator Storm Thorgeson

Newly remastered and assembled by long time Pink Floyd producer and engineer James Guthrie

$24.98 suggested CD list price

PUBLICITY/TV:

USA Today Coming Attractions feature on September 21st

Multiple national magazine features in the works

Transatlantic Artwork media launch to unveil new art and music simultaneously in London, Birmingham, Manchester, NYC, LA & Seattle on October 8th

RADIO/VIDEO:

MJI Broadcast Radio Special syndicated to over 200 stations

National Classic Rock promotion with over 100 Laseriums/planetariums

Special "win it before you can buy it" promotions for rock, classic rock, news and talk radio stations in the top 150 markets

VH1 promotion to include: airing of 'The Wall' movie, VH1 Classics Retrospective, news coverage and contest

NEW MEDIA:

First official web site (pinkfloyd.co.uk) designed by Storm Thorgeson and to be promoted via Pink Floyd E trading cards to be distributed through wireless devices and IM, Pink Floyd player (audio, video - epk, trivia questions, digital download), IM sound bites and buddy icons to include Pig, Cow and Prism etc., Amazing Mail postcards, Echoes screen saver, Viral marketing campaign

MARKETING:

Extensive DRTV marketing campaign starting 4 weeks prior to street date

Massive launch events in NYC (Rockefeller plaza) and Los Angeles (Capitol Tower)

EMG Marketing to coordinate college 'Wall' screenings, 'Echoes' weekend events, laser shows in top 20 markets w/ Classic Rock tie-ins, and a 5 week print campaign in the top 56 weeklies and college papers

Music video intercuts w/ the NFL, NBA, NHL, ML Baseball, NASCAR, NHRA Hot Rod, ML Soccer, Arena Football & the X-Games

SFX venue tour marketing with stickers and buttons at like genre shows

Noize Pollution - street marketing in top 20 markets

General Cinema weekend 'Wall' screenings tied to rock radio

HIQI Art House Pink Floyd film screenings tied to Rock radio in top 5 markets

Black market stencil marketing (icons - pig, cow, prism) in top 10 markets

ADVERTISING:

Consumer: NY Times, LA Times, USA Today, Rolling Stone, Playboy, Maxim, top 56 weeklies, NFL - NBA sport souvenir programs, top 25 college newspapers

Trade: Billboard magazine back cover spread & Hits back cover

Radio: Extensive Westwood One national radio buys targeting the NFL, AM Sports Talk/News and Classic Rock

TV: massive campaign to start one month before street date and will include several thousand direct response and broadcast spots

Outdoor: snipes in the top 10 markets

Other: video & audio promotions with United Artists, General Cinemas, Movie Tunes, United & Northwest Airlines

RETAIL:

Package includes 2 CD's, 27 tracks and a 32 page booklet complete w/ lyrics and original art by Storm Thorgeson

10 song CD sampler for in store play

Dump bin for new release and catalog

Co-op dollars available for holiday advertising

First compilation to span the bands entire 35 year career!

Since 1999 Pink Floyd titles have scanned over 5 million copies in the US

TOOLS:

Dump bins, pre-release banners, window acetates, 2-sided poster, collectable buttons, 1x1's, 2x2, mobiles, bin cards, balloons

CD: C2KT-36111

CS: C4TA-36111

VINYL: C1WS-36111

Disc ONE

Astronomy Domine

See Emily Play

The Happiest Days Of Our Lives

Another Brick In The Wall (Part 2)

Echoes

Hey You

Marooned

The Great Gig In The Sky

Set The Controls For The Heart Of The Sun

Money

Keep Talking

Sheep

Sorrow

PINK FLOYD

David Gilmour (guitars)

Nick Mason (drums)

Roger Waters (bass)

Richard Wright (keyboards)

Except tracks 1 and 2: Syd Barrett, Nick Mason, Roger Waters, Richard Wright, and tracks 7, 11 and 13: David Gilmour, Nick Mason, Richard Wright, and track 9: Syd Barrett, David Gilmour, Nick Mason, Roger Waters, Richard Wright.

Compilation produced by James Guthrie and Pink Floyd.

Mastered by Doug Sax, James Guthrie and Joel Plante at das Boot recording.

1/4 inch transfers assisted by Robert Hadley.

To compile this album, the original analogue master tapes were played back on custom tape machines built by The Mastering Lab (1/4inch) and Tim de Paravicini (1/2inch). Custom valve EQ was by Esoteric Audio Research. 24 bit Analogue to Digital converters by dB Technologies fed the SADiE workstation. Monitoring DACs were by dCS.

Disc TWO

Shine On You Crazy Diamond (Parts 1-7)

Time

The Fletcher Memorial Home

Comfortably Numb

When The Tigers Broke Free

One Of These Days

Us And Them

Learning To Fly

Arnold Layne

Wish You Were Here

Jugband Blues

High Hopes

Bike

PINK FLOYD

David Gilmour (guitars)

Nick Mason (drums)

Roger Waters (bass)

Richard Wright (keyboards)

Except tracks 9, 11 and 13: Syd Barrett, Nick Mason, Roger Waters, Richard Wright, and tracks 8 and 12: David Gilmour, Nick Mason, Richard Wright. Tracks 3 and 5: David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Roger Waters.

Cover by Storm Thorgerson.

Graphic design Peter Curzon.

Photography Rupert Truman and Sam Brooks.

With thanks to Jason Reddy, Finlay Cowan, Dan Abbott and Hothouse.

Pink Floyd management Steve O’Rourke EMKA Productions Ltd.

Roger Waters management Mark Fenwick MFM Ltd.

All lyrics reproduced by kind permission of the Publishers.
